The Elder Paduma’s Birth Story
“Revealing the Four Truths,
the one who has the best Dhamma,
rains down the deathless rain,
extinguishing the great people.
Taking a lotus born that day,
I stood on the threshold
of the Sage Padumuttara,
and I threw it up into the air.
And as the lotus was coming,
it was a wonder for a while.
Knowing my thought,
the best of speakers took it.
Having taken the best of flowers,
the best of actions,
the Teacher, standing in the Community of monks,
recited these verses:
‘Since this lotus was thrown
to the Omniscient Leader,
I will proclaim it,
listen to me as I speak.
For thirty eons the Lord of the Gods
will be the King of the Gods,
and for seven hundred years on earth
he will live in the land.
Having counted the leaves there,
he will be a Universal Monarch,
and then a rain of flowers
will fall from the sky.
For a hundred thousand aeons,
